name: dirtily
content:
dirtily adverb
(NOT HONESTLY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is unfair, dishonest, or unkind: He fought his political opponents again, often dirtily and never nicely. It was an ill-tempered match in which both teams played dirtily.
More examplesFewer examplesThey both fought hard, and at times dirtily, to secure senior roles.The country has been treated dirtily in the past by western powers.Elections in this part of the world are often fought dirtily.

dirtily adverb
(NOT POLITELY)
in a way that is connected with sex, and that many people think is offensive: He sneered at her dirtily. He laughed dirtily.
More examplesFewer examples"You obviously enjoy the physical side of life," he said dirtily.The show involved nudity, which was dirtily handled.
dirtily adverb
(NOT CLEAN)
in a way that is not clean: Hot oil and grease drops dirtily onto the floor. When I complained, a dirtily clothed chef appeared.
More examplesFewer examplesThe prison inmates were thinly and dirtily clad.
